title: Financial cyber crime losses in the U.S. 2018 , by victim state
yAxis: Annual loss in million U.S. dollars
summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Annual loss in million U.S. dollars for 10 number of States.
The Annual loss in million U.S. dollars is appeared to be the highest at State California and lowest at State Massachusetts.
The difference of Annual loss in million U.S. dollars between the highest and lowest State is 382.24.
min_summary: This is a bar chart representing State in the x axis and Annual loss in million U.S. dollars in the y axis.
The maximum Annual loss in million U.S. dollars 450.48 is found at State California and the minimum is found at Massachusetts where State is 68.24.
mid_summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Annual loss in million U.S. dollars for 10 number of States.
The Annual loss in million U.S. dollars is appeared to be the highest at State California and lowest at State Massachusetts.
The difference of Annual loss in million U.S. dollars between the highest and lowest State is 382.24.
max_summary: This bar chart has 10 columns on the x axis representing State, and Annual loss in million U.S. dollars in each State on the y axis.
The maximum Annual loss in million U.S. dollars 450.48 is found at State California and the minimum is found at Massachusetts where State is 68.24.
State New York has the second highest value for Annual loss in million U.S. dollars.
The highest State California has 382.24 more Annual loss in million U.S. dollars than the lowest State Massachusetts.
The State California has the highest Annual loss in million U.S. dollars, followed by New York, and Texas. Down to the State Massachusetts which is the lowest.
The State Massachusetts has 2.87 times less Annual loss in million U.S. dollars than average.
